Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

III. INVESTIGATION

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Approximately a week and a half ago, a staff member allowed two
youth to go into a bathroom together where the youth engaged in
sexual contact. Youth are not supposed to enter the bathroom
together. Girls are being unsupervised and engaging in sexual
activities at Vista Maria.
Investigation Interviews
On 12/02/2024 an interview was completed with Compliance at
Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. He was advised
of the allegations. Compliance confirmed he was aware of the
allegations and advised that he would provide policy, face sheets
and incident reports. He further advised that there is no video
footage at this time as the approximate date and time is still
unknown.
On 12/02/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
B at Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. She
confirmed that she has resided at Freedom Hall for the past 5
months. She reported that the incident between her and Youth A
happened “weeks ago”. She acknowledged the incident as her
and Youth A going into the bathroom together and engaging in
sexual activity. She could not remember the exact date and time,
but stated it happened on second shift. She stated she did not
recall what staff was working that day and denied speaking to
anyone about the incident. She reported that it was just her and
Youth A in the bathroom. She stated typically more than one
youth is not allowed to go into the bathroom together unless staff
are monitoring outside of the door. She denied that staff were
monitoring. She then stated “we snuck and did it”. She denied
knowing where staff was at the time and requested for the
interview to end.
On 12/02/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth A
reported being at Freedom Hall for about four months. She
confirmed the allegations of her and Youth B being in the
bathroom alone and engaging in sexual activity as truth. She
2

denied knowledge of the date and time it occurred. When asked if
youth are allowed to go into the bathroom together, she replied “it
depends on the staff”. She confirmed that Staff 1 was working on
the day the incident occurred. Youth A further reported that she
and Youth B knew that Staff 1 would allow them to go into the
restroom together and that is why they asked her. She stated that
Staff 1 was working on another day when she allowed her and
Youth E to go into the bathroom together. Youth A could not
recall the date the previous incident occurred, but stated it was
after a substance abuse education meeting. She stated that she
does not think Staff 1 is aware why they are requesting to go to
the bathroom together but confirmed that she does not monitor
them. Youth A denied that she is able to go into the bathroom
with another youth while other staff are on shift.
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
C at Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. She
confirmed she is currently placed on C Wing at Freedom Hall.
She confirmed being familiar with Staff 1 and reported that she
allows youth to go into the restroom together whenever they want.
Youth C denied every making a request or plan to go into the
bathroom with another youth but confirms she has seen other
youth ask and be told yes. Youth C denied that other staff allow
this to happen. She reported that the rule is only one youth is
allowed in the bathroom at one time and if there is more than one,
then staff have to be at the door to monitor.
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
D at Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Youth D
denied going into the restroom alone with other youth. She
reported that “it depends on the staff” if youth are allowed to go
into the bathroom together without staff monitoring. She denied
knowing the name of the staff that would allow youth to go into the
bathroom together. She expressed her understanding of the rule
to be that 2 youth should not be in the bathroom alone without
staff being present at the door to monitor.
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1
at Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 1
confirmed she has been employed at the agency for about 11
months. She advised of her understanding that if more than one
youth wanted to go into the bathroom at a time they would either
have to wait until one was finished or staff would ask the youth if
they are comfortable with the other youth entering. Staff 1 also
stated that if 2 or more youth are in the bathroom, staff should be
“around” and then clarified that staff should be standing at the
3

doorway. Staff 1 denied allowing youth to go into the bathroom
together. She stated she never allows youth to use the bathroom
at the same time and denied hearing anything about inappropriate
behavior that occurs between youth in the bathroom; not on her
shift or during shift of other staff. Staff 1 further denied allowing
Youth A and Youth B to go into the restroom together during her
shift.
On 12/10/2024 an in-person interview was completed with
Compliance at Vista Maria. DHHS Specialist was also present.
He confirmed that the agency does not have a specific policy
regarding bathroom use. He confirmed that there was no video
footage available for the incident. DHHS Specialist discussed the
safety plan for Staff 1.
On 12/12/2024 a voice mail correspondence was left for FCW
requesting a return call with any additional information or concerns
regarding placement at Vista Maria.
On 12/23/2024 an email correspondence was received from
Compliance. He advised that Staff 1 and Staff 4 are both no
longer employed with Vista Maria.
On 12/23/2024 a telephone interview was completed with
Complainant and no additional concerns were reported.
On 12/23/2024 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 2.
DHHS Specialist also participated. Staff 2 confirmed that she is
no longer employed at Vista Maria. She reported she overheard
Youth B talking to other youth about how she had been asked for
a favor from Youth A. The favor included oral sex. Youth A and
Youth B stated they waited until Staff 1 was working because they
knew she would allow them to go in the bathroom together. Staff
2 stated that Youth B stated they both went into the bathroom and
engaged in sexual activity. Staff 2 stated she also found a note
that fell from the belongings of Youth B where she had written that
she engaged in sexual activity with Youth A when Staff 1 was
working. Staff 2 denied having any previous information that Staff
1 was allowing this to occur. She denied having worked with Staff
1 or hearing that she would allow activity like this.
On 12/23/2024 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 3.
DHHS Specialist also participated. Staff 3 confirmed she has
been an employee for one year. Staff 3 reported being notified of
the concerns by Staff 2 that overhead the information from Youth
B. She was informed that Youth A and Youth B were reported to
4

have gone in the bathroom together and engaged in sexual
activity. She was asked if she was aware of Staff 1 having
previously allowed youth in the bathroom together. She denied
she had. She reported that protocol is that only one youth can be
in the bathroom at a time. She denied knowledge of the date the
incident occurred. She denied ever hearing or seeing any other
staff has allowed youth to go in the bathroom in pairs.
On 12/23/2024 a telephone call was attempted to Staff 4. A
voicemail message was left requested a return call regarding Vista
Maria.
On 01/14/2025 an email correspondence was received advising of
additional concerns of lack of supervision by Staff 1 involving
Youth E.
On 01/27/2025 a video interview was completed with Youth E.
She confirmed she was previously placed at Vista Maria. She
also stated that she remembered being placed at Vista Maria with
Youth A and Youth B. Youth E denied ever engaging in
inappropriate sexual activity with any other youth at Vista Maria in
the bathroom. She did recall Staff 1 and reported that she would
allow youth to do whatever they wanted and this included going
into the bathroom without her providing supervision.
On 02/19/2025 an in-person interview was completed at Vista
Maria with Youth F, Youth G and Youth H. All youth denied
knowledge of youth being allowed to go into the bathroom
together. They also denied knowledge of Staff 1 allowing youth to
go into the bathroom in pairs without supervision.
On 02/19/2025 a DHHS Case Conference was held via Teams.
DHHS and DCWL staff were present. DHHS advised there were
no findings relative to allegations of physical neglect.
Documents Reviewed
Vista Maria Client Supervision Policy (POL 005 008) - Policy
states the following: Clients on all units are to be continually
supervised. Staff members who are responsible for client
supervision should maintain line of sight management of those
clients at all times.
Vista Maria Incident Reports (IR) –
Incident #1900 11/25/2024 1:30pm submitted by Staff 4. IR
indicated that she overheard youth on the wing discussing that
Youth A had asked Youth B for a favor which included engaging in
5

oral sex and “putting her finger in her vagina”. Youth B confirmed
that she did it and that they planned to wait until Staff 1 was on
shift to do it because she would trust them in the bathroom alone.
IR indicates they were in the bathroom for about 8 to 10 minutes.
Incident #1905 11/26/2004 2:24pm submitted by Staff 3. IR
indicated that she overheard Youth B tell other residents that she
asked Youth A for a favor that included performing oral sex and
putting her finger in her vagina. Youth B admitted that she
engaged in the activity and also stated that they waited to request
to go to the bathroom when Staff 1 was present because she
would trust them. According to Youth B they were in the bathroom
for about 8 to 10 minutes.
Vista Maria HR file of Staff 1: File included documentation of
Written Warning on 7/17/24 for violation of Employee Behavior
and Supervision policies (doing crossword puzzles/not properly
supervising clients on wing)
Verbal Warning on 5/16/24 for violation of Employee Behavior
policy (giving candy to select clients)
Memo of Understanding on 4/16/24 violation of Employee
Behavior (use of cell phone and coloring, not directly engaging
with clients on wing)
Tour of Agency
On 12/10/2024 and 02/19/2025 a walk through of the bathroom
area of the agency was completed. No areas of concern were
noted and area was found to be appropriate.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth
were interviewed, and it was determined that the staff failed to
provide adequate supervision of the youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
